author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: ْلِكَ عَلَى وُجُوهِ خَلْقِكَ بَعْدَ إِذْ فَتَحْتَهُ بِعِزِّكَ وَسُلْطانِكَ، وَهَلْ تُسَكِّرُ أَبْصارَ بَرِيَّتِكَ بَعْدَ إِذْ هَدَيْتَهُمْ إِلى مَشْرِقِ جَمالِكَ وَمَطْلَعِ أَنْوارِ وَجْهِك؟ لا وَعِزَّتِكَ لَيْسَ هذا ظَنِّيْ وَظَنَّ المُقَرَّبِينَ مِنْ عِبادِكَ وَالمُخْلِصِينَ مِنْ بَرِيَّتِكَ، أَيْ رَبِّ تَعْلَمُ وَتَرَى وَتَسْمَعُ بِأَنَّ عِنْدَ كُلِّ شَجَ
translation: Wilt Thou keep back from Thee the stranger whom Thou didst call unto his most exalted Home beneath the shadow of the wings of Thy mercy, or cast away the wretched creature that hath hastened to attain the shores of the ocean of Thy wealth? Wilt Thou shut up the door of Thy grace to the face of Thy creatures after having opened it through the power of Thy might and of Thy sovereignty, or close the eyes of Thy people when Thou hast already commanded them to turn unto the Dayspring of Thy Beauty and the Dawning-Place of the splendors of Thy countenance?
